meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -!

Okay, okay, I know what you're thinking... another review, another score, another list of pros and cons. But let's be real, folks, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned arcade racing game? And Horizon Chase 2 delivers just that - pure, unadulterated speed, wrapped in a retro-chic package that'll have you revving your engines in no time.

Now, I know what some of the other critics are saying. "Good track design and blistering sense of speed aren't enough to compensate for relatively mindless racing," says Gaming Nexus. Um, excuse me? Mindless racing? That's like saying a hot dog isn't complete without a bun - it's just wrong!

Meanwhile, Push Square thinks the online multiplayer is the real MVP. And hey, I won't argue with that - there's something special about racing against friends (or strangers) in real-time. But let's not forget the main event: the actual racing itself.

And then we have PlayStation Universe, declaring Horizon Chase 2 a "phenomenal package" for arcade racing fans. Yaaas, please! I mean, who wouldn't want to experience the thrill of high-speed chases, hairpin turns, and power-ups galore?

GameSpew agrees, calling it a "must-have" for fans of the genre. And Impulsegamer takes it a step further, saying it's a "template of what a sequel should be." That's some high praise, right there!

Last but not least, IGN Spain chimes in with a simple yet effective summary: "classic arcade experience... encapsulates nostalgia... and adapts for new devices." Boom - that's what I'm talking about!

And finally, Player 2 gives us a reality check, pointing out some of the game's weaker points (progression may feel automated, audio mixing is lacking). But hey, even with those flaws, Horizon Chase 2 remains an "entertaining enough choice" for fans of the genre.

So there you have it - my take on Horizon Chase 2. Is it a perfect game? Heck no! But is it a whole lot of fun? You bet your bottom dollar it is!

Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got some racing to do...
